overview: From 2025-11-01 to 2025-12-01, elizaos-plugins/plugin-farcaster had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 8 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Use messaging service
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Unifies Farcaster interaction handling via Message/Cast services, adds a thread context provider, switches build to Bun, and standardizes logging/error handling.
> 
> - **Farcaster core**:
>   - **Unified interaction handling**: `FarcasterInteractionManager` now delegates mention processing to `runtime.messageService.handleMessage`; adds webhook/polling sources with factory and deduplication.
>   - **MessageService enhancements**: refactors cast-to-message mapping, adds `getThread`, and normalizes send/get methods and metadata.
>   - **Service wiring**: `FarcasterService` instantiates and exposes `getMessageService`/`getCastService`; structured logs and health check details.
> - **Actions & Events**:
>   - Update actions (`sendCast`, `replyCast`) to use Message/Cast services, return `void`, enforce 320-char limit, and use `runtime.logger`.
>   - Event handlers (`messageHandler`) store/augment cast metadata and switch to `runtime.logger`.
> - **Providers**:
>   - Add `farcasterThreadProvider` and export via `farcasterProviders`; improve profile/timeline providers with better errors and logging.
> - **Managers**:
>   - Interaction source split into polling/webhook with structured error logging; posting manager logs and scheduling robustness.
> - **Tests**:
>   - E2E/suite updated to use `getCastService`/`getMessageService`, add send/retrieve, reply threading, and health checks.
> - **Build & Config**:
>   - Migrate build to Bun (`build.ts`), add `tsconfig.build.json`, adjust `package.json` scripts; minor TS config changes.
>   - Config validation tweaks (`ZodError.issues`) and logging of validated settings.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 1c123ae256ec0dbee01e34f1e7187fd6db88db8d. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added a Farcaster thread provider to fetch and present conversation context.

* **Refactor**
  * Switched project build to a Bun-driven build flow.
  * Centralized message handling via a unified message service.
  * Updated Farcaster terminology from "Post" to "Cast".
  * Standardized logging across handlers and services; updated handler return shapes.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved error handling and validation reporting.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Improve Farcaster Configuration Handling & API Updates (v1.0.6)
topPRs.author: rferrari
topPRs.body:
This PR introduces several improvements to the Farcaster plugin, focusing on enhanced configuration flexibility, updated API method names, optional callback handling, and better test coverage for configuration validation. It also bumps the plugin version to **1.0.6**.

---

## Configuration & Credential Handling
- **Prioritize character-level settings** in `config.ts` when resolving Farcaster credentials (`FARCASTER_FID`, `FARCASTER_SIGNER_UUID`, `FARCASTER_NEYNAR_API_KEY`).
- Support credentials provided in `runtime.character.settings` and under `secrets.*` namespaces.
- Added detailed **debug logging** for configuration resolution and validation, making it easier to troubleshoot missing credentials.
- Enhanced `validateFarcasterConfig()` to include structured debug output for key Farcaster parameters.

---

## Test Suite Improvements
- Introduced a **configuration validation test** (`testConfiguration`) to verify the Farcaster setup for each agent at runtime.
- Reworked `FarcasterTestSuite` to dynamically determine whether to run **real or mock tests** based on available credentials.
- Added structured and readable console output for configuration states and credential presence.
- Introduced mock test fallback logic (`credentialedOrMockTest()`) to avoid unnecessary test failures when Farcaster credentials are not provided.

---

## API Updates & Deprecation Cleanup
- Replaced deprecated method calls:
  - `getPostService` → `getCastService`
  - `createPost` → `createCast`
  - `getPosts` → `getCasts`
- Ensured consistent naming across E2E scenarios for better alignment with the latest Farcaster SDK.

---

## Interaction Handling
- Updated `callback` in `interactions.ts` to make file parameters **optional**, improving flexibility for integrations without attachments.

---

## E2E Scenarios
- Updated test cases to use `getCastService` and `createCast` consistently.
- Improved error handling and logging for `getMentions()` and `getCasts()` results.
- Added safeguards for mock vs. real testing modes.

---

## Changelog

| Type | Description |
|------|--------------|
| **feat** | Prioritize character settings in Farcaster configuration |
| **fix** | Make callback files optional |
| **fix** | Replace deprecated Farcaster API methods (`getPosts`, `createPost`, etc.) |
| **chore** | Update plugin version to `1.0.6` |
| **test** | Add configuration validation and mock fallback tests |

---

## Version
`@elizaos/plugin-farcaster` → **v1.0.6**

---

## Why This Matters
These changes improve developer experience and plugin stability by:
- Allowing multi agents to define Farcaster credentials directly in character settings.
- Reducing false negatives in tests when environment variables are missing.
- Ensuring alignment with the latest Farcaster SDK changes.
- Simplifying integration testing and debugging workflows.

---

## Testing
- **Unit Tests:** All pass successfully  

```bash
bun run test:unit
$ vitest run __tests__/unit

 RUN  v3.2.4 /projects/plugin-farcaster

 ✓ src/__tests__/unit/common/types.test.ts (29 tests) 26ms
   ✓ Profile Type > should accept valid profile with all properties 2ms
   ✓ Profile Type > should accept profile with only required properties 1ms
   ✓ Profile Type > should handle edge case values 0ms
   ✓ Cast Type > should accept valid cast with all properties 2ms
   ✓ Cast Type > should accept minimal cast with only required properties 1ms
   ✓ Cast Type > should handle empty text and zero stats 1ms
   ✓ CastId Type > should accept valid cast id 0ms
   ✓ CastId Type > should handle empty hash and zero fid 0ms
   ✓ FidRequest Type > should accept valid fid request 1ms
   ✓ FidRequest Type > should handle boundary values 0ms
   ✓ LastCast Interface > should accept valid last cast 0ms
   ✓ LastCast Interface > should handle zero timestamp 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should validate complete valid configuration 3ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should apply default values when optional fields are missing 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should transform string booleans to actual booleans 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should throw error for invalid FARCASTER_FID 2ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should throw error for missing required fields 2ms
   ✓ FarcasterConfigSchema > should throw error for empty required strings 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterEventTypes Enum > should contain all expected event types 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterEventTypes Enum > should have exactly 3 enum values 1ms
   ✓ FarcasterEventTypes Enum > should allow valid enum assignments 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterMessageType Enum > should contain all expected message types 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterMessageType Enum > should have exactly 2 enum values 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterMessageType Enum > should allow valid enum assignments 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterGenericCastPayload Interface > should accept valid payload structure 0ms
   ✓ FarcasterGenericCastPayload Interface > should handle minimal payload structure 0ms
   ✓ Type Integration Tests > should create a complete workflow with all types 0ms
   ✓ Type Integration Tests > should validate configuration with realistic values 0ms
   ✓ Type Integration Tests > should handle edge cases across all types 0ms

 Test Files  1 passed (1)
      Tests  29 passed (29)
   Start at  18:45:41
   Duration  495ms (transform 98ms, setup 0ms, collect 121ms, tests 26ms, environment 0ms, prepare 103ms)
```

---

- **Manual Validation:** Confirmed proper detection of credentials

```bash
...
 Debug      [hasFarcasterEnabled] FID: Found
 Debug      [hasFarcasterEnabled] Signer UUID: Found
 Debug      [hasFarcasterEnabled] API Key: Found
 Debug      [validateFarcasterConfig] Resolved FID: 1
 Debug      [validateFarcasterConfig] Resolved Signer UUID: Found
 Debug      [validateFarcasterConfig] Resolved API Key: Found
 Log        Farcaster Client Configuration:
 Log        - FID: 1
 Log        - Dry Run Mode: enabled
 Log        - Enable Cast: enabled
 Log        - Cast Interval: 90-180 minutes
 Log        - Cast Immediately: disabled
 Log        - Action Processing: enabled
 Log        - Action Interval: 1000 minutes
 Log        Farcaster client initialized in dry run mode - no actual casts should be posted
 Info       [SUCCESS] Farcaster Neynar client initialized.
 ...
```

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Chores**
  * Version bumped to 1.0.6

* **Refactor**
  * App terminology migrated from post-centric to cast-centric naming
  * Configuration detection expanded to prefer secret sources and now emits debug logs for resolved values

* **Tests**
  * Per-test credential-aware mode added to run real or mock variants and surface configuration status

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Mention callback accepts an optional files parameter; unhealthy health details now logged as strings
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topContributors.summary: odilitime: This month, odilitime made significant contributions to documentation and bug fixes, while also initiating new feature work. They landed a major documentation update in elizaos/spartan#21, which added over 5,000 lines, and also merged a fix for tasks in elizaos-plugins/plugin-birdeye#7. In addition to this merged work, they have several features in progress for the elizaos/eliza repository, including a new framework for adjusting prompts (#6113). Their activity shows a primary focus on general development and bug fixes, with contributions spread across code, tests, and documentation.

0xbbjoker: This month, 0xbbjoker focused on extending plugin capabilities by implementing a key feature in `elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter` via PR #17. This significant contribution added support for `TEXT_EMBEDDING` models, involving changes across code, tests, and configuration files. In addition to this feature work, they also contributed one pull request review.

standujar: Focused on developing several key features this month, with a significant amount of work in progress across multiple repositories. They opened pull requests to implement entity-level row-level security (elizaos/eliza#6107) and integrate a unified messaging API for the Discord plugin (elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord#24). This work, while not yet merged, involved substantial changes across 187 files (+4640/-1654 lines) and 25 commits. Based on their code changes, their effort was primarily centered on new feature development and refactoring.

Freytes: Focused on adding substantial new features to the `elizaos/spartan` repository, merging four significant pull requests. Their most impactful contributions included introducing a new Chrome extension in PR #17 (+42042 lines) and a Farcaster miniapp in PR #19 (+13210 lines). Freytes also improved the developer experience by adding Docker support for an easier development setup in PR #20. In total, their work added over 67k lines of new code and tests to build out major new components for the project.

wtfsayo: This month, wtfsayo focused on maintenance within the `elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp` repository. They merged a single pull request (#18) to update action names and dependencies, which involved a significant refactor that removed nearly 400 lines of code. Their commits were distributed across feature work, bug fixes, and tests, primarily modifying code, documentation, and configuration files.

borisudovicic: Focused on planning and defining future work for the elizaos/eliza repository this month. They initiated discussions on several potential features by creating issues for "Points / Leaderboard" (#6110), "Background tasks" (#6109), and "Parallel actions" (#6108).

rferrari: This month, rferrari focused on initiating improvements to plugin functionality and developer tooling. They proposed enhancements to the Farcaster plugin's configuration and API handling in an open pull request (elizaos-plugins/plugin-farcaster#13). Additionally, rferrari opened an issue to improve debugging support in the core application (elizaos/eliza#6154).

LinuxIsCool: This month, LinuxIsCool's contributions were focused on project maintenance within the elizaos/eliza repository. They identified and opened two issues regarding project health: #6122 about missing documentation and #6121 concerning an outdated changelog.

ai16x402: This month, ai16x402 focused on expanding the plugin ecosystem by opening three pull requests to add new plugins to the `elizaos-plugins/registry` (#237, #238, #239). This work, which is still in progress, involved 7 commits and modifications to configuration files (+80/-18 lines). They also participated in discussions with 3 comments on pull requests.

madjin: This month, madjin focused on expanding the project's pipeline configuration. They merged a pull request in elizaos/elizaos.github.io (#169) that added 12 new active repositories to the system. This work consisted entirely of modifications to configuration files.

Neysixx: Focused on extending command-line functionality in the elizaos/eliza repository this month. They opened a pull request to add a new embedding option (elizaos/eliza#6142), which involved modifying 6 files with significant changes (+620/-545 lines). This work, which included new tests, was an even mix of feature development, bug fixing, and refactoring.

ChristopherTrimboli: Focused on supporting the team through code review this month, performing 3 reviews which included 2 approvals and 1 request for changes. He also made progress on a local refactoring effort, committing changes across 17 files.

tungpun: This month, tungpun focused on improving stability in the `elizaos/eliza` repository by addressing a potential race condition. They opened a pull request (#6137) to remove a message emit in the source API, a change that modified 24 files (+272/-57 lines). This work indicates a focus on bug prevention and code maintenance.

nguyennk92: This month's work was focused on adding an authentication token to the Socket.io server, proposed in the open pull request elizaos/eliza#6144. The contribution consisted of 3 commits modifying 5 files. The changes touched application code, configuration, and tests, indicating a primary focus on feature work and its associated testing.
otaku-x402: No activity this month.

skurzyp: This month, skurzyp's activity was focused on identifying future technical debt by opening an issue in `elizaos/eliza` (#6145) to track the necessary migration from a deprecated version of Langchain.
github-advanced-security: No activity this month.
devbrett90-prog: No activity this month.
humuhimi: Contributed to repository stability by identifying and reporting a significant bug in `elizaos/eliza` (#6138), where disabling the Web UI was incorrectly blocking all endpoints.

samarth30: This month, samarth30's contribution was focused on planning for new billing functionality in the Eliza Cloud product. They initiated this effort by creating an issue to track the integration of Stripe for settings and billing (elizaos/eliza#6118).
tdnupe3: This month, tdnupe3 contributed to the elizaos/eliza repository by opening an issue (#6148) to propose a new plugin submission for "Coin Railz x402 Micropayment Services".
nikatuz8-cell: Contributed to the elizaos/eliza repository by opening and closing an issue related to migration (#6149).
linear: This month's activity consisted of creating an issue to define entity-level row-level security in elizaos/eliza (#6112).
christophwallacher-web: This month, christophwallacher-web's activity consisted of identifying and reporting a potential bug in the `elizaos/eliza` repository by opening issue #6140.

TommyVeit: This month, TommyVeit's activity was focused on the `elizaos/eliza` repository, where they identified and reported a user-facing bug. They opened and subsequently closed issue #6158 concerning a snapshot eligibility and wallet connection problem.
870171594: This month's activity was limited to the elizaos/eliza repository, where they opened an issue (#6156) to inquire about API capabilities.
